intro: Conostylis aculeata var. typica, commonly known as the stiff-haired conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. Conostylis aculeata var. typica is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun conditions.
